snippet: Corporations, looking to slash their legal costs, have cut their billable hours steeply in the last five years, a report found, and those cuts have fallen particularly hard on entry-level lawyers.
abstract: Corporations, looking to slash their legal costs, have cut their billable hours steeply in the last five years, a report found, and those cuts have fallen particularly hard on entry-level lawyers.

headline.main: Corporations Drive Drop in Law Firms' Use of Starting Lawyers, Study Finds
